thread.title: Oakland Raiders Confirm Move To Las Vegas
thread.title_full: Oakland Raiders Confirm Move To Las Vegas

author: Victoria Hernandez
title: Oakland Raiders Confirm Move To Las Vegas

organizations.name: oakland raiders confirm move to las vegas oakland raiders

text:
Oakland Raiders Confirm Move To Las Vegas March 27, 2017 | 2:48 PM 1 
Phoenix, AZ – The Oakland Raiders are officially moving to the desert as reports confirm that NFL owners approved the move 31-1 (the Miami Dolphins were the lone dissenter) in a meeting in Phoenix today (March 27). 
With Los Angeles now being home to the Rams and Chargers, there was no room for the former L.A. Raiders to return south. They’ll stay in Oakland at least through the 2017 season and have another one-year option at the Oakland Coliseum, which could keep them there another year. Owner Mark Davis says that he plans on staying for those two years. Embed from Getty Images 
Once the Raiders move to Las Vegas, they are expected to play at a new 65,000-seat stadium that will be finished by 2020. They will share the venue with UNLV. 
The Raiders have a storied history with Hip Hop, especially when they were in Los Angeles. After winning two Super Bowls in Oakland, the team moved to the City of Angels in 1982 where they won their third title a year later, dividing the country with owner Al Davis, head coach John Madden, running back Marcus Allen and wide receiver Tim Brown. Embed from Getty Images 
Davis’ infamous saying, “Just Win Baby, Win” is used by Snoop Dogg in DJ Khaled’s “All I Do Is Win” and, in the team’s heyday, N.W.A helped unify the Raiders with Hip Hop, wearing the team’s gear and matching the squad’s flagrant attitude. 
Even Jay Z changed the colors of the Nets when the team moved to Brooklyn from red and blue to black and white, acknowledging the power of the colors.
